name: Black Magic and the Supernatural Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: The discredited 'science' of phrenology explained behavior via the 'bumps' in one's head. Who is credited - if that is the word - with the development of this technique?
questions.explanation:
Franz Joseph Gall.

	At least he called some attention to the important function of the brain. As to the meaning of the "bumps", however, there's not much that modern science has to say in support of his theory.

questions.text: 'Mesmerism', a forerunner of hypnosis, was developed by Franz Anton Mesmer. Mesmer, however, didn't really understand what he had discovered. How did he explain his 'treatment'?
questions.correct: Restoring the proper balance of magnetic fluids in the body
options: Restoring the level of the four basic elements to the body
Restoring the proper flow of blood in the body
Restoring the proper respiratory rate to the body
questions.explanation:
Restoring the proper balance of magnetic fluids in the body.

	He was something of a P.T. Barnum. He knew that he had something, but didn't know what it was. So, he put on a nice show and hoped for the best.

questions.text: What is the principal difference between an incubus and a succubus?
questions.explanation:
Different Genders.

	The former is male; the latter is female.

questions.text: Two men named Sprenger and Kramer wrote a book which was the 'bible' of the Middle Ages in terms of witchcraft, magic, sorcery, etc. What is the title of the book?
questions.explanation:
The Witch Hammer.

	In Latin, "Malleus Maleficarum". It's amazing to believe that people actually believed this stuff.

questions.text: The belief that a person can be transformed into a wolf is known by what term?
A ghost or spirit who engages in mischief is known by what term?
questions.explanation:
Poltergeist.

	Some ghosts are scary; some ghosts are troublesome.

questions.text: The idea that there was a curse on the people who came into contact with King Tut's tomb originated with the untimely death of this individual.
questions.explanation:
Lord Carnarvon.

	Carnarvon financed Howard Carter - the man who found Tut in the 'Valley of the Kings'. Carnarvon died shortly after entering the tomb - under somewhat mysterious circumstances. Ever since that time, the legend of a curse has been part of the story of King Tut.

questions.text: How many cards are there in a deck of tarot cards?
questions.explanation:
78.

	There are 56 (Minor Arcana) and 22 (Major Arcana) in a deck.

questions.text: Witches are often said to have "familiars". Where are these "spirits" usually found?
questions.explanation:
Their pets.

	Black cats are the most well-known example.

questions.text: What useful substance is derived from the saliva of vampire bats?
questions.explanation:
Anti-Coagulant Agent.

	There is actually a substance called 'draculin'. It may sound ghoulish, but whatever works is acceptable.
